meanings.definition: To use or work at excessively.
meanings.sent1: She kept overplying the paint on the canvas, making it too thick.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overply when it comes to adding sugar to his coffee.
meanings.sent3: The chef was overplying the salt in the soup, turning it into a salty ocean.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm for gardening was like overplying a balloon until it bursts.
meanings.sent5: The children were overplying the playground equipment, causing it to wear out quickly.

meanings.definition: To apply too much pressure or force.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic was overplying the wrench, risking damage to the bolt.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally overplied pressure on the fragile glass, causing it to crack.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was overplying force on the toy, making it break apart.
meanings.sent4: The storm was overplying the trees with strong winds, bending them to their limits.
meanings.sent5: The weightlifter was overplying his strength, struggling to lift the heavy barbell.

meanings.sent1: He was overplying his excitement about the upcoming party, making it seem like the event of the year.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overply her achievements, making them sound more impressive than they are.
meanings.sent3: The comedian was overplying his jokes, turning a simple story into a wild adventure.
meanings.sent4: The author was overplying the drama in the novel, creating unrealistic plot twists.
meanings.sent5: The actor was overplying his emotions on stage, making the audience feel overwhelmed.
